title: Half of police chiefs will not stand again
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Half of police chiefs will not stand again Adam Simmonds, the Conservative PCC for Northamptonshire, is not standing again Fiona Hamilton Crime Editor Published at 12:01AM, October 26 2015 
Half the elected police chiefs are not expected to stand again after their four years in office, The Times has learnt. 
An analysis of the re-election intentions of the 41 police and crime commissioners in England and Wales concluded that about 20 of them would not seek a second term at elections in May. Nearly a quarter have already announced that they will stand down. 
The numbers are a blow to the Conservative government, which replaced police authorities with the commissioners during its coalition with the Liberal Democrats. 
Supporters of PCCs had hoped for a higher number of re-election attempts, Subscribe now
